      • RarestFirstSelector

        public RarestFirstSelector()

    • Method Detail

      • rarest

        public static RarestFirstSelector rarest()
        Regular rarest-first selector. Selects whichever pieces that are the least available (strictly following the order of increasing availability).
        Since:
        1.1

      • randomizedRarest

        public static RarestFirstSelector randomizedRarest()
        Randomized rarest-first selector. Selects one of the least available pieces randomly (which means that it does not always select THE least available piece, but rather looks at some number N of the least available pieces and then randomly picks one of them).
        Since:
        1.1

      • getNextPieces

        public IntStream getNextPieces(BitSet relevantChunks,
                               PieceStatistics pieceStatistics)
        Description copied from interface: PieceSelector
        Select pieces based on the chunks which are relevant. Relevant means that the peer we are selecting pieces for has this chunk and we do not have this chunk locally
        Specified by:
        getNextPieces in interface PieceSelector
        Parameters:
        relevantChunks - the relevant chunks to chose (in the peer's completed list,
        pieceStatistics - the piece statistics
        Returns:
        the stream of the next pieces to get
